intro: Tetranthera waitziana, commonly known as the Waitzian tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
